Profil: Shareable ValueSet

  • Include ces codes sont définis dans 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.8.2.1
    CodeDisplay
    532pT1 [I]: Cervical carcinoma confined to uterus (extension to corpus should be disregarded)
    533pT1a [IA]: Invasive carcinoma diagnosed by microscopy only. All macroscopically visible lesions (even with superficial invasion) are pT1b/1B.
    534pT1a1 [IA1]: Stromal invasion < =3.0 mm in depth and horizontal spread < =7.0 mm
    535pT1a2 [IA2]: Stromal invasion >3.0 mm but not more than 5.0 mm in depth and horizontal spread <=7.0 mm
    536pT1b [IB]: Clinically visible lesion confined to the cervix or microscopic lesion greater than T1a2/IA2
    537pT1b1 [IB1]: Clinically visible lesion <=4.0 cm in greatest dimension
    538pT1b2 [IB2]: Clinically visible lesion >4.0 cm in greatest dimension
    539pT2 [II]: Tumor invades beyond the uterus but not to pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina
    540pT2a [IIA]: Tumor without parametrial invasion
    541pT2a1 [IIA1]: Clinically visible lesion <=4.0 cm in greatest dimension
    542pT2a2 [IIA2] Clinically visible lesion >4.0 cm in greatest dimension
    543pT2b [IIB]: Tumor with parametrial invasion
    544pT3 [III]: Tumor extends to the pelvic wall and/or involves the lower third of the vagina and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney
    545pT3a [IIIA]: Tumor involves lower third of vagina, but not pelvic wall
    546pT3b [IIIB]: Tumor extends to pelvic wall and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney
    547pT4 [IVA]: Tumor invades the mucosa of bladder or rectum and/or extends beyond true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient evidence to classify a tumor as pT4)

name: JDV_Col_Uterus_pT_CISIS_CISIS

concept.display: pT1 [I]: Cervical carcinoma confined to uterus (extension to corpus should be disregarded)
pT1a [IA]: Invasive carcinoma diagnosed by microscopy only. All macroscopically visible lesions (even with superficial invasion) are pT1b/1B.
pT1a1 [IA1]: Stromal invasion < =3.0 mm in depth and horizontal spread < =7.0 mm
pT1a2 [IA2]: Stromal invasion >3.0 mm but not more than 5.0 mm in depth and horizontal spread <=7.0 mm
pT1b [IB]: Clinically visible lesion confined to the cervix or microscopic lesion greater than T1a2/IA2
pT1b1 [IB1]: Clinically visible lesion <=4.0 cm in greatest dimension
pT1b2 [IB2]: Clinically visible lesion >4.0 cm in greatest dimension
pT2 [II]: Tumor invades beyond the uterus but not to pelvic wall or to lower third of vagina
pT2a1 [IIA1]: Clinically visible lesion <=4.0 cm in greatest dimension
pT2a2 [IIA2] Clinically visible lesion >4.0 cm in greatest dimension
pT3 [III]: Tumor extends to the pelvic wall and/or involves the lower third of the vagina and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney
pT3a [IIIA]: Tumor involves lower third of vagina, but not pelvic wall
pT3b [IIIB]: Tumor extends to pelvic wall and/or causes hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney
pT4 [IVA]: Tumor invades the mucosa of bladder or rectum and/or extends beyond true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient evidence to classify a tumor as pT4)
